Well I'll be slapped silly. :beers:

This is a bit weird, I downloaded the css and added it on a page and it doesn't work.  But when I used the remote css from `http://elrumordelaluz.github.io/csshake/css/csshake.min.css` .  Everything went well.

@paparts here I paste all the css, create a span.shake and work well here. Are you using Prefixfree? For now, the package doesn't contains the prefixed animations/transforms. You have to use something like this on the main @​mixin, or Prefixfree, or just visualize in a browser that don't need -prefixes. Unfortunately today we still needing -prefixes for some css stuff.
no im not using prefixfree, I am using it on a simple form.  Actually at this site http://backticksolutions.com
Don't know why, not work by link cssshake.css to html `<link type="text/css" href="csshake.css">`. but worked by copy css code to the head of html file's `<head>`

@paparts if you don't use prefixfree you've to edit the sass files to add all vendor prefixes, otherwise it'll only works in browsers that do not need prefixes like Firefox.
I'll add the vendor prefixes in the main sass files soon, but personally I wish one day ALL browsers will support animations/transforms without it.
@vitoziv but http://elrumordelaluz.com/public/videos/screen.mp4

@elrumordelaluz see my test ![https://www.dropbox.com/s/m53ha1yqi7yrtxo/shake-test.gif](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/m53ha1yqi7yrtxo/shake-test.gif?dl=1&token_hash=AAHxabFC9VEXQto2RnaJhcsVqXlgqnzR2y192EARwD5wJA)

change to `csshake.min.css` don't work either.  Just me have this problem? 

![shake test 2](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/qw3omtd9q7p18nq/shake-test-2.gif?dl=1&token_hash=AAFvxJaPGhmqdf2Y_thHUALnxBZajpqTYAviwQsc251LWQ)
Use Firefox for local testing. It's a prefexfree.min.js issue: http://leaverou.github.io/prefixfree/#faq. Look under "How do I enable local testing?". If you want to use chrome, enable local XHR.
right again @smyoon315

@lehtu There is an advice (and now in strong) that the main code doesn't include -prefixes. However I'll add a vendor prefixes @mixin for these situations asap. Hoping one day we won't need -prefixes.

Cool @cobaimelan! At the beginning I was going to release it with those @​mixins. Anyway I'm thinking in adding something like this to help some situations/needs. It'd be perfect a @​mixin that render the -prefixed @keyframes only with the -prefixed transforms, though.


wow!
Vendor prefixes added (without redundancy), please let me know.
From now you can use it on every (modern) browser, though. Just added vendor-prefixes on main @​mixins
awesome dude :)

Thank you for your response,

In Chrome it's working locally when I run my project from Netbeans with tomcat local server, but when the web app is hosted in Apache server, there is no shaking effect using Chrome, it's working with IE and Firefox.
Thanks

using localhost it's working in Chrome, but when the web app is hosted in Apache server, it's not working for Chrome, but working for IE and Firefox.
Thanks

@elrumordelaluz Hi! Sorry for the delay. I'm using the latest sass version. The function random is included, but that's not what's actually failing. It somehow fails while performing the multiplication on its result. However, a division goes perfectly fine.

I just tested here on an Apache server, and for me it's working in Chrome. Did you download the last version that include -webkit prefix? Because on the first release I didn't added vendor prefixes on the main sass mixins and for example, on FF works well without prefixes.
I was confused for a second, since http://elrumordelaluz.github.io/csshake/ works as expected on Chrome, but that's because it's still pulling in http://leaverou.github.io/prefixfree/
Really! @millette I didn't realized that there still there without *vednorized. I just added with some other changes. Thanks man!

it did generated the compiled file but it didn't worked.
if i replace it with your compiled file it works
could you show me the generated file? didn't shows you any error when compiling? have you a last version of sass that include random() function?
Sure it's possible. I'll try to add as soon as possible, except you did before and make a pull request.

Great, thank you !

Perfect! I didn't know how to test prior but just did and it works as I expected. Thanks.
just `bower install csshake`, cool!

I was having issues specifically with https://github.com/yeoman/generator-gulp-webapp and when I would `gulp wiredep` it wouldn't add the link like it should have. It simply didn't know what files to include.

Now it actually adds the stylesheet and works perfectly. You can test by installing the gulp-webapp generator and starting a new project.
I'll try it.
The documentation says `freeze` is this a mistake in the documentation or the library?
I think there's a mistake in de docs because the right class is `.freez`. Where did you found it?
Working for me in Chrome 45.0.2454.99 (64-bit)

I added this feature in the [last release](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/releases/tag/v1.5). Hope it works for you. Thanks for the proposal!
Added this feature in the [last release](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/releases/tag/v1.5)
hey @blixt first of all, thanks for the idea. I added this feature in the [last release](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/releases/tag/v1.5)

@raphaelgoetter since in the [last release](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/releases/tag/v1.5) I reduce the code into only one mixin to generate the animations, now is easier to generate separated classes. Also added a [Download center](http://csshake.surge.sh/) with the core animations to download separately. Thanks again!
@sapher you are absolutely right. what do you think on include also `scss/csshake.scss` as main file for preprocessor?
ok. it was in the docs, just not in the _tools.scss comments

Thanks @williamli. There is the comment [here](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/blob/master/scss/_tools.scss#L25) in the `_tools.scss` file. Maybe you downloaded/forked before a commit with this specific change.
Anyway I found that the `$opacity` explanation is missed in `README.md` file, after the code example. Thanks again!

I think I got it from the latest release branch instead of master.

Hi @furier ,
Could you make a [pen](http://codepen.io/) or show code in some way?

I have only had this problem on my setup with asp.net mvc5 on windows server 2008 R2 virtual machine with remote desktop. I changed to using anijs instead, and using the rubberband animation instead, so now im unable to make a video to show you.
ok @furier feel free to comment to reopen this Issue in case you need.
great, thanks!
Cool @OpherV thanks!

thanks @AlphaGit, merged!
However I'd appreciate if you have a screenshot or could explain what is the behaviour you had in Edge. Since I an working on OSX I did a simple [pen](http://codepen.io/elrumordelaluz/pen/9c925051ea3ef55c5572e6e5405428a7) to test via [crossbrowsertesting](crossbrowsertesting.com) and didn't see nothing strange, and didn't found any [bug](https://connect.microsoft.com/IE/Feedback) related.

Hi! Sure, here's a quick comparison:

https://youtu.be/4cJTRG_nLIE

You will see some slight differences but this is the actual test case:

I have an application which on a particular form, on validation error, will add the shake-horizontal class and remove it 300ms later. In Chrome, Safari, and even IE, the form will shake side to side, and later stop.

On Edge the form went NUTS (it was actually pretty funny). It would shake in several directions, increasing the intensity noticeably and then repeating cycles, but certainly not side to side. It would also not stop on its own.

I was working on an old version of the library so I updated and I created my own animation with `do-shake`, but after a while of fighting with the parameters I realized that the problem was with Edge itself. The rest is this PR. :)

lol, sooo funny! 
thank you for the video @AlphaGit, thanks again for the PR.

Hi @seb0zz don't understand why you need to have the `shake-constant` class as a new shake animation class when it [exists](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/blob/master/scss/_tools.scss#L97) yet as a _helper class_. 

[Here](http://codepen.io/elrumordelaluz/pen/9c925051ea3ef55c5572e6e5405428a7) you have an example to see how it works, just apply the `shake-*` animation constantly.

`shake-constant` should be defined importing the file `csshake.scss` since it imports `_tools.scss` where is defined a variable `$prefix: 'shake' !default;` used in [some lines](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/blob/master/scss/_tools.scss#L83-L98) to define the class `.#{$prefix}-constant === .shake-constant` inside each animation created. 
`shake-constant` does not have an independent behaviour, need to be used as a _modifier_ of a animation created through `do-shake()` mixin. 
Did you tried `@extend`ing `shake` or another `shake-*` animation?
Yes I tried that but then I am only able to get the shake effect on hover.

Right. To have available this class you have to at least _process_ an animation thorugh the mixin. Creating a class `.shake-constant   { @include do-shake('shake-constant'); }` will give you the same situation of using `@extend .shake` (but in this case `.shake-constant`) and you'll need to call .shake-constant.shake-constant to have it constantly (like we talked before).

Did you tried importing the desired animation from `dist`? Do you have a repo or something with this working?
The first one works, thanks!
cool! let me know if there's another behavior with css-modules.
@paya-cz thanks for the idea, included [here](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/commit/1d111730e0665bddcca42b8cad2c8bd04974527d)
Good catch, thanks!
Should be solved with last changes, thanks!

@greaterweb thanks for the catch, [this](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/blob/v1.5.1/scss/_tools.scss#L14-L16) should be correct now!

Let me know and thanks again.
Confirmed working. Thanks for the prompt attention, @elrumordelaluz!
@ariunbayar Thanks for the idea. Solved [here](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/csshake/commit/d73157e1e4d0e677968bfcc28c0839f063f4b75a).
Alternatively, just use a relative protocol and support both HTTP and HTTPS (though I believe HTTP can load HTTPS resources. Just not the other way around.)
For any reason everything is working for me, but you are absolutely right. Thank you @aboutaaron for the PR!

Hello @madruga88 and thanks for the interest.
**CSShake** is based on `random` numbers for its _presets_. You could play around with some numbers in the [reshake](https://github.com/elrumordelaluz/reshake) playground [here](https://elrumordelaluz.github.io/reshake/) but I think you could use the awesome [Bounce.js](http://bouncejs.com/) library to create this kind of _controlled_ animations.

@antivitla I understand what you mean.

>Probably your initial target audience was bower-users 
Not sure if `bower` users but probably most without bundler process -like projects. 

Could you please provide an example on what `webpack`  do or miss about this package? 
_Bootstrap_ has the `js` files as `main`. 

I think a good solution could be `"main": "dist/csshake.css"`, in case this work for you (and hopefully for all the `npm` users) absolutely appreciate a PR!

Thanks for the catch!
Yes, it turns out that `"main": "dist/csshake.css"` makes webpack satisfied. And we can use same syntax for importing it in css|stylus|sass. I've tested, seems all good. Made a PR :)
Thanks @antivitla !

@punshonjm thanks for reporting the issue.
At the beginning the _shaked_ element needs a `display` property to allow transformations. 
You are absolutely right that removing/commenting this property prevents this strange behaviour. 
A simple fix (PR welcome!) could be to switch `display: inline-block` that assume a specific relation with the layout/context into `display: inherits` or test again use cases without `display` property at all. 
In case you want to contribute with a PR (could be awesome!), should be necessary to test with different kind of html elements because browsers assign a default `display` prop in some elems.
In case I found a document with this assumptions will share here.

Otherwise, when as soon as I have a peace of time I'll fix this.

Thanks again,

Hi @gaining,

This [demo](https://elrumordelaluz.github.io/csshake/) is hosted in `gh-pages`

Could you please provide more info or a link/repo to see what is the problem?
The site is: https://jonlive.github.io/bootstrap-site/index.html, the image is supposed  to shake
Mixed content issue, try updating the _CSShake_ stylesheet url into `https://csshake.surge.sh/csshake.min.css`

Since you are using only `shake-hard` class, you could also use this url `https://csshake.surge.sh/csshake-hard.min.css` instead of the full package stylesheet to save kb (perf matters)

More urls options in [cdnjs](https://cdnjs.com/libraries/csshake)
Thanks for replying so fast. I will try this.
Thanks again. You have fixed my issue.

I have the same issue, only with an additional problem:

When I try to use "Freezed after Shake" in Safari 11.1.2, it does not work. Additionally via some JavaScript, I am changing the `innerHTML` of the shaking div every few seconds, but it somehow "freezes" the bottom part of the text, so only the top part changes (see gif). The text is not shaking at all.

Any way of doing something about this?

Edit:
Adding a gif, so it is more clear what I am talking about:

![20180827-155534_screencapture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9803905/44663771-bb662680-aa11-11e8-9e0d-95359351ea09.gif)
